questions.question: Design a fixed-size ring buffer in C that stores bytes. Capacity N is a power of two (e.g., 1024). Show how to compute the next index using a mask (idx & (N-1)), and explain full vs empty detection using only head and tail counters. Provide enqueue and dequeue logic for a single-producer/single-consumer scenario?
questions.answer: Use two indices: head and tail. Let mask = N-1. Enqueue: if ((head - tail) == N) return 0; data[head & mask] = value; head++; Dequeue: if (head == tail) return 0; *out = data[tail & mask]; tail++; Thi
